content:
• Thursday, May 30, 2013
  • ESL

    More on Esterline Technologies (NYSE:ESL): FQ2 misses on all counts as total sales dipped by 1%...

    More on Esterline Technologies (NYSE:ESL): FQ2 misses on all counts as total sales dipped by 1% from the prior year period. Net earnings also fell 21% as the specialty manufacturer posted lighter sales for avionics and controls, as well as sensors and systems due to the ongoing decline in defense spending. Reflecting those challenges, the company cut its full-year outlook, now expecting to earn between $5.30 to $5.50 a share, down from $5.45 to $5.80, with sales expected to be around $2B, versus previous estimates of $2.1B. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 PM
  • AIQ-OLD

    Alliance Healthcare Services (NYSE:AIQ-OLD) jumps 13.07% Thursday to $15.31; that's good for a...

    Alliance Healthcare Services (NYSE:AIQ-OLD) jumps 13.07% Thursday to $15.31; that's good for a 104% gain since SA Pro contributor Intangible Valuation said the stock was "worth at least $10.60" on April 1, citing — among other factors — its attractive FCF yield.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • UPI

    More on Uroplasty (NASDAQ:UPI): Q4 misses across the board as total sales slipped 1% year over...

    More on Uroplasty (NASDAQ:UPI): Q4 misses across the board as total sales slipped 1% year over year. U.S. sales increased 2%, driven by an 11% increase in sales of the Urgent(NYSE:R) PC Neuromodulation System, but global sales declined 1% to $5.5M. Additionally, the company said that Wisconsin Physicians Services, a Medicare Administrative Contractor providing benefits to approximately 8.7M Medicare beneficiaries in nine Midwestern states, will begin coverage for its Posterior Tibial Nerve Stimulation device as a treatment for overactive bladders and associated symptoms starting June 1. Shares +9.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) gets a bump higher in the post session following positive...

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) gets a bump higher in the post session following positive comments from Alpha One's Dan Niles on CNBC's Fast Money. Niles said that Sony's PlayStation 4 and Microsoft's Xbox One would be a strong driver for the chipmaker, and the shares could double over the next few years. (Video). Shares +0.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM | 6 Comments
  • GPK

    Graphic Packaging (NYSE:GPK) announces a secondary offering, saying that certain stockholders...

    Graphic Packaging (NYSE:GPK) announces a secondary offering, saying that certain stockholders are offering 15M shares. The company, has a current float of around 347.5M shares, won't receive any proceeds from the offering. BofA Merrill Lynch and Citigroup are acting as the joint book runners. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • OVTI

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:45 p.m.: OVTI +15.9%. KKD +9.7%. GES +8.4%. LGF +4.4%. UGI...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:45 p.m.: OVTI +15.9%. KKD +9.7%. GES +8.4%. LGF +4.4%. UGI +3.9%.
    After-hours top losers: PANW -13.7%. SPLK -3.8%. GPK -3.3%. MHGC -2.9%. ESL -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • CMCO

    After years of being dragged down by pension liabilities, SA Pro's Nick Ghattas says that...

    After years of being dragged down by pension liabilities, SA Pro's Nick Ghattas says that Magnetek (MAG +12.7%) may be poised for big gains. He notes that the gigantic liability has created an overhang masks that its cash flow power and the underlying value of the business. Also, industry headwinds appear to be turning into tailwinds, and management is making intelligent decisions by exiting unprofitable or unstable businesses and honing in key line items, all which should contribute to driving the shares higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • GES

    More on Guess' (NYSE:GES) Q1: Comps sales decrease 9.8% Y/Y and adjusted earnings per share fall...

    More on Guess' (NYSE:GES) Q1: Comps sales decrease 9.8% Y/Y and adjusted earnings per share fall 53.3% but beat estimates handily. "The near term outlook for consumer spending remains soft," CEO Paul Marciano notes. FY14 outlook: EPS of $1.70-1.90 on revenue of $2.57-2.61B versus consensus of $1.79/share on $2.6B. FQ2 outlook: EPS of $0.34-0.38 on revenue of $620-635M versus consensus of $0.36/share on $618.43M. Shares +9.47% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) +16.3% AH after resuming trading in the wake of its FQ4 beat and strong...

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) +16.3% AH after resuming trading in the wake of its FQ4 beat and strong FQ1 guidance. Shares have made a new 52-week high of $18.02, and are now up 28% YTD. 14.6% of the float was shorted as of May 15, providing ample fuel for a squeeze.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • SKS

    Neiman Marcus' private-equity owners TPG and Warburg Pincus declined an offer to merge the...

    Neiman Marcus' private-equity owners TPG and Warburg Pincus declined an offer to merge the retailer with Saks (NYSE:SKS), WSJ says, citing sources who claim the deal undervalued Neiman. Other stumbling blocks included logistical difficulties, overlap, and the sheer complexity of the undertaking. Shares of SKS -1.33% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • LAKE

    There may be smoke at Lakeland Industries (NASDAQ:LAKE), but there's no fire, says SA Pro...

    There may be smoke at Lakeland Industries (NASDAQ:LAKE), but there's no fire, says SA Pro contributor Whopper Investments, who notes that thanks to a few rather unfortunate events (previous), the stock trades well below NCAV. If investors can get over the past and focus on an improving earnings picture, the stock could jump markedly. Shares +16.38% Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • OVTI

    More on OmniVision: FQ1 guidance is for revenue of $355M-$390M and EPS of $0.35-$0.52, above a...

    More on OmniVision: FQ1 guidance is for revenue of $355M-$390M and EPS of $0.35-$0.52, above a consensus of $347.2M and $0.29. FQ4 revenue fell 21% Y/Y, likely due to lower Apple orders. Gross margin was 17.5% +60 bps Q/Q and -500 bps Y/Y. Opex +3% Y/Y. Is the strong guidance a sign of a design win for the expected low-cost iPhone? OmniVision is already designed into the iPhone 5, 4th-gen iPad, and iPad Mini. OVTI halted, CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • KKD

    More on Krispy Kreme's (KKD) FQ1: The upbeat tone management struck during last quarter's CC...

    More on Krispy Kreme's (KKD) FQ1: The upbeat tone management struck during last quarter's CC ("great" February traffic counts, 9% comps growth in week 5) plays out well, as revenues, operating income, and adjusted net income rise 11.2%, 40%, and 37% respectively in FQ1. Same-store sales growth comes in at 11.4%. CEO James Morgan calls the performance "exceptional," and raises FY14 EPS guidance to $0.59-0.63/share versus consensus of $0.58. Shares +10% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) now -13.9% AH in response to its mixed FQ3 results. With shares...

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) now -13.9% AH in response to its mixed FQ3 results. With shares trading at lofty multiples, there was little margin for error. In its PR, Palo Alto mentions seeing a "touch macroeconomic environment" (peers can sympathize), but doesn't give a specific reason for its revenue miss. Revenue growth of 54% is a slowdown from FQ2's 70%. Still, deferred revenue rose 17% Q/Q to $219.3M. Opex +70% Y/Y to $80M, with sales/marketing spend +71% to $51.7M (51% of revenue). CC getting started (webcast), guidance should be provided. Off in sympathy: CHKP -1.2%. FIRE -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ4 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $336.2M beats by $17.94M....

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ4 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $336.2M beats by $17.94M. Shares halted. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • LGF.A

    More on Lions Gate Entertainment's (LGF) FQ4: The studio ended the fiscal year with a bang to...

    More on Lions Gate Entertainment's (LGF) FQ4: The studio ended the fiscal year with a bang to take its revenue haul for the period up 71% Y/Y to $2.71B, led by a 96% rise in its Motion Picture segment. Home entertainment revenue improved 41% to $964.1M during FY13 as The Hunger Games and Twilight series both had a strong post-theater life. Profitability was boosted by a drop in interest expenses and lower distribution costs. The company's filmed entertainment backlog (contracted future revenue not yet recorded) was $1.1B at the end of the quarter. LGF +3.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (SQNM +1.7%) finishes higher after saying it's entered into a technology licensing and...

    Sequenom (SQNM +1.7%) finishes higher after saying it's entered into a technology licensing and marketing agreement with Laboratoire Cerba in France for noninvasive prenatal aneuploidy testing. Under the agreement, SQNM will license its cell-free fetal nucleic acid technology to Laboratoire Cerba to establish its noninvasive fetal aneuploidy testing service in France, as well as Belgium, Luxembourg and portions of the Middle East and Africa. The contract is effective immediately and active through 2018.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme (KKD): Q1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $120.6M (+11.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Krispy Kreme (KKD): Q1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $120.6M (+11.2% Y/Y) beats by $4.63M. Shares +10.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 4 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ4 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $785.7M beats by...

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ4 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $785.7M beats by $53.62M. Shares +2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • ESL

    Esterline Techs (NYSE:ESL): FQ2 EPS of $1.12 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $499.5M misses by...

    Esterline Techs (NYSE:ESL): FQ2 EPS of $1.12 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $499.5M misses by $7.57M. Shares -2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW): FQ3 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $101.3M (+54% Y/Y)...

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW): FQ3 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $101.3M (+54% Y/Y) misses by $2.16M. Shares -9.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q1 EPS of -$0.06 in-line. Revenue of $57.2M (+54% Y/Y) beats by $3.17M....

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q1 EPS of -$0.06 in-line. Revenue of $57.2M (+54% Y/Y) beats by $3.17M. Shares -5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • ON

    Chip stocks close with solid gains (SOXX +1.5%) after Avago beats April quarter estimates and...

    Chip stocks close with solid gains (SOXX +1.5%) after Avago beats April quarter estimates and makes encouraging comments about mobile, industrial, and enterprise networking demand. In addition to Avago's rivals and Cirrus Logic (previous), big winners include Fairchild (FCS +3.8%), SanDisk (SNDK +2.7%), Spreadtrum (SPRD +7.2%), and InvenSense (INVN +4.9%), as well as touchscreen controller suppliers Synaptics (SYNA +4.3%), Atmel (ATML +6.3%), and Cypress (CY +2.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • FCX

    Leaders of Indonesia's miners union say they will call on workers not to return to Freeport...

    Leaders of Indonesia's miners union say they will call on workers not to return to Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +2.3%) Grasberg complex until an investigation behind the tunnel collapse that killed 28 people is completed. The news means copper production could be sidelined for several more weeks, increasing pressure on an already tight market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • POL

    PolyOne (POL -1.2%) completes the sale of its non-core, specialty resins business to Mexichem...

    PolyOne (POL -1.2%) completes the sale of its non-core, specialty resins business to Mexichem SAB. The Mexican chemicals and plastics company is a major producer of PVC and plastic tubing, and paid $250M for the assets, which include plants in New Jersey and Illinois, as well as a research center in Ohio. POL now says it has at least $1M available for additional acquisitions of its own in the near and medium term.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • GV

    Goldfield (GV +19.3%) skyrockets on the day of its annual meeting. In his speech (transcript),...

    Goldfield (GV +19.3%) skyrockets on the day of its annual meeting. In his speech (transcript), CEO John Sottile discusses Q1 operating results, expresses confidence in operating margins going forward, and says a recent analyst report validates the strong demand GV is seeing for its services. Sottile, like SA contributor The GeoTeam, notes that GV's non-CREZ revenue grew 68% in FY12 and says management believes it "will meet the challenge of replacing the work from the CREZ project." For the counterpoint, see SA contributor Sarah Tyler's March article.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • MGPI

    MGP Ingredients (MGPI +10.2%) soars after saying it has retained BMO to assist in a review of...

    MGP Ingredients (MGPI +10.2%) soars after saying it has retained BMO to assist in a review of strategic alternatives. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • USNA

    USANA Health (USNA +1%) spikes lower but still remains in the green after a mid-day downgrade to...

    USANA Health (USNA +1%) spikes lower but still remains in the green after a mid-day downgrade to Neutral on valuation by D.A. Davidson. The firm cites caution on the back of some insider selling into the stock's 73% runup recently, adding big to the 110% gain it's racked up since February.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • JOY

    Investors overlook Joy Global's (JOY +2.8%) gloomy outlook and prefer to focus on a respectable...

    Investors overlook Joy Global's (JOY +2.8%) gloomy outlook and prefer to focus on a respectable quarter that saw gross margins rise both annually (+10bp) and sequentially (+40bp). Analysts say orders will need to improve for JOY to achieve its 2014 goal of flat revenues, but the feeling is that the company is managing the ugly coal market as well as can be expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • GASS

    StealthGas (GASS +3.6%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $14 price target at Deutsche Bank,...

    StealthGas (GASS +3.6%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $14 price target at Deutsche Bank, which likes GASS' niche in the Handysize liquefied petroleum gas market as one of the few sectors of shipping with strong demand fundamentals and modest fleet expansion. Demand will be driven primarily by increased LPG exports in the Middle East and oncoming U.S. exports.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • FRED

    Retailer Fred's (FRED +5.2%) is a winner today thanks to Q1 results that beat estimates on the...

    Retailer Fred's (FRED +5.2%) is a winner today thanks to Q1 results that beat estimates on the top and bottom line. More from the report: Net income and EPS rise 9.1% and 10.7% respectively during the quarter even as comps growth came in negative (-1.3%). CEO Bruce Efird notes that the results topped the high end of guidance which he attributes to "the immediate impact" of a reconfiguration plan that benefits gross margin. Outlook: FQ2 and FY13 EPS of $0.06-0.09/share and $0.77-0.88/share respectively, against consensus of $0.10/share and $0.82/share. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +26%) is now within $0.02 of Dish's (DISH +0.5%) $4.40/share offer price;...

    Clearwire (CLWR +26%) is now within $0.02 of Dish's (DISH +0.5%) $4.40/share offer price; upgrades from DA Davidson and Raymond James could be helping. Macquarie asserts the move "forces SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) to negotiate with Dish," and raises the odds SoftBank walks away from Sprint (S +0.3%). The firm thinks Sprint will now have to offer $4.50+/share for Clearwire. Likewise, JPMorgan argues Dish is "attempting to de-value the Softbank bid by injecting itself into Clearwire as a permanent ... minority shareholder." Wells Fargo: "We can't see how Charlie doesn't win here--he is either going to get the partnership we believe he always wanted ... or he is going to walk away with a significant amount of spectrum."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 10 Comments
  • DELL

    EMC (EMC +5.3%) and 80%-owned VMware (VMW -1.6%) head in opposite directions after the former...

    EMC (EMC +5.3%) and 80%-owned VMware (VMW -1.6%) head in opposite directions after the former issued fresh guidance to go with news it's raised its buyback authorization by $5B to a remaining $5.5B, initiated a dividend, and promised to spend $3B on buybacks between now and Q2 2014. Though EMC reiterated its 2013 free cash flow guidance of $5.5B, Stifel thinks the specifics suggest VMware's cash flow estimates are too high. EMC's outstanding authorization, which lasts until the end of 2015, is good for buying 10.5% of shares at current levels. Wells Fargo sees the buybacks lifting 2014 EPS by $0.11. Deutsche sees EMC's dividend rising over time.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • GLCH

    Gleacher & Company (GLCH -0.9%) announces a reverse stock split of its common stock at a...

    Gleacher & Company (GLCH -0.9%) announces a reverse stock split of its common stock at a ratio of 1-for-20. The split will become effective after the close on May 30, 2013 and the stock will begin trading on The Nasdaq Global Market on a split-adjusted basis when the market opens on May 31, 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro (RFMD +3.9%) jumps following an upgrade to Buy from DA Davidson. Shares were already...

    RF Micro (RFMD +3.9%) jumps following an upgrade to Buy from DA Davidson. Shares were already higher thanks to rival Avago's (AVGO +10.6%) FQ2 beat and upbeat commentary. On its earnings call, Avago mentioned orders for the Galaxy S4 and other 4G devices partly offset Apple-related weakness, and that it expects a "very strong ramp" in iPhone-related orders in FQ3. Avago claims the technical demands of 4G phones are lifting sales of chips using its FBAR filters, which offer performance advantages over traditional SAW filters. RBC recently estimated Avago had a ~70% share of the FBAR market. Rivals Skyworks (SWKS +3.7%) and Anadigics (ANAD +4.5%) are also up, as is Apple-dependent Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN -1.7%) says the FDA has granted priority-review designation to...

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN -1.7%) says the FDA has granted priority-review designation to Vimizim, an enzyme-replacement therapy under evaluation for the treatment of the rare lysosomal storage disorder Mucopolysaccharidosis Type IVA, also called Morquio A Syndrome.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • NBGGY

    Midday top 10 gainers: NBG +475%. CLWR +24%. NVE +22%. GV +19%. AIQ-OLD +17%. BVX +16%. CLSN...

    Midday top 10 gainers: NBG +475%. CLWR +24%. NVE +22%. GV +19%. AIQ-OLD +17%. BVX +16%. CLSN +16%. AAU +15%. BAA +14%. GURE +13%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ABIO -30%. VIMC -20%. DLIA -13%. VRTB -11%. CVI -11%. HSOL -10%. WPCS -10%. AGII -9%. ARTX -8%. ALVR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 5 Comments
  • FRO

    Frontline (FRO -6%) trades lower after releasing Q1 earnings and issuing a weak outlook for Q2....

    Frontline (FRO -6%) trades lower after releasing Q1 earnings and issuing a weak outlook for Q2. The company was blunt in its own assessment of the tanker market, saying it's "massively oversupplied" and that it may take some time before a reasonable market balance is restored.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • EPD

    Enterprise Products Partners (EPD -2.3%) says it plans to develop two refined products export...

    Enterprise Products Partners (EPD -2.3%) says it plans to develop two refined products export facilities on the Texas coast. Export service at the Beaumont marine terminal will initially handle Panamax size vessels and should begin service in Q1 2014, followed in mid-2014 by its expanded marine terminal on the Houston Ship Channel that will be initially sized to handle up to Aframax class vessels.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEMP

    Cempra (CEMP +3.2%) moves up today after saying earlier that the USPTO issued a patent on May 28...

    Cempra (CEMP +3.2%) moves up today after saying earlier that the USPTO issued a patent on May 28 relating to the company's loading dose regimen for Taksta, which will provide protection until 2029. The drug is currently undergoing a Phase 2 clinical study in patients with prosthetic joint infections, with the loading dose regimen designed so that the drug would rapidly reach therapeutic blood levels and minimize the risk of drug resistance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • CIT

    CIT Group (CIT +6.1%) soars after the Fed finally ends its enforcement agreement with the...

    CIT Group (CIT +6.1%) soars after the Fed finally ends its enforcement agreement with the company - in place since August 2009. The move, says Mark Palmer, likely presages the next announcement - the approval for returns of CIT's "ample capital" to shareholders. Palmer believes the stock has another big leg up, whether or not it becomes an acquisition target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • HMY

    South African gold miners enjoy another strong performance, aided by rising gold prices and...

    South African gold miners enjoy another strong performance, aided by rising gold prices and fresh lows in the rand; the rand-price of gold is up almost 10% in the last two weeks. Harmony Gold (HMY +9.9%) and Sibanye Gold (SBGL +5.9%), which own primarily South African assets, are surging; shares with more international exposure also post healthy gains: GFI +4.5%, AU +6.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN +2.5%) prices its convertible debt offering at very favorable terms. The notes,...

    Priceline (PCLN +2.5%) prices its convertible debt offering at very favorable terms. The notes, which are due 2020, will pay an interest rate of just 0.35% and sport a conversion price of $1,315.10/share, 62% above Priceline's current trading price. The buyback that will be financed by the debt offering is good for repurchasing 2.5% of shares at current levels. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE +3.6%) is working with Morgan Stanley and Citi to explore Dan Loeb's proposal to spin...

    Sony (SNE +3.6%) is working with Morgan Stanley and Citi to explore Dan Loeb's proposal to spin off the company's entertainment ops, Bloomberg reports. Shares have spiked higher on the report after drifting lower over the last 9 days. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • WMGI

    Wright Medical (WMGI +3.2%) rises on an upgrade to Buy from Neutral (price target, $32) at...

    Wright Medical (WMGI +3.2%) rises on an upgrade to Buy from Neutral (price target, $32) at Summer Street. "Are you pioneers in this space?" analyst Mark Landy asked management on the latest CC, referring to WMGI's new Wright Direct program, "or are you see[ing] competitors [trying to] put a wedge between the salesperson and the physician?" "No, we haven't seen competitors do this … in orthopedics," CEO Robert Palmisano said, adding that "It's very important [for] institutions [to ask] 'how can we get more cost out?'" (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 5 Comments
  • YPF

    Argentina's Congress passes controversial legislation pardoning tax evaders if they invest their...

    Argentina's Congress passes controversial legislation pardoning tax evaders if they invest their hidden cash in construction projects or use it to buy bonds to help finance state-run oil company YPF (YPF -1.6%). The law aims to bring much-needed U.S. dollars into the economy, but opponents say it places the interests of criminals ahead of law-abiding citizens who pay their taxes. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • AEE

    Utilities are getting a bit of a reprieve after taking a beating over the past few days. Option...

    Utilities are getting a bit of a reprieve after taking a beating over the past few days. Option implied volatility has been increasing as investors rotate out of high dividend yield positions in the wake of a rise in treasury yields: AEE +1.7%, D +0.3%, DTE +1.9%, EIX +0.6%, ETR +1.3%, EXC +0.7%, FE +0.9%, NEE +1.7%, PEG +0.8%, PPL +0.5%, SRE +1.3%, TE +0.5%, AEP +0.8%, DUK +0.6%, ED NU +1.6%, PCG +1.2%, SO +0.4%, XEL +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 5 Comments
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics (IMMU +12.4%) soars after CEO Cynthia Sullivan calls recent results from clinical...

    Immunomedics (IMMU +12.4%) soars after CEO Cynthia Sullivan calls recent results from clinical trials of IMMU-130 and IMMU-132 "particularly encouraging" at the New York Biotechnology Association's Annual Meeting Wendesday. Tumor shrinkage witnessed in the trials suggests the two drug candidates may have potential for treating colorectal, triple-negative breast, bladder, pancreas, prostate, kidney, and ovarian cancers "after they become refractive to conventional chemotherapeutic agents." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • SUNEQ

    Goldman puts MEMC (WFR +5.2%) on its Conviction Buy list and raises its PT to $10 from $8. The...

    Goldman puts MEMC (WFR +5.2%) on its Conviction Buy list and raises its PT to $10 from $8. The firm assigns MEMC a sum-of-the-parts valuation of $11, including a $5 valuation for its chip wafer ops. Rising chip industry multiples and a more shareholder-friendly board are seen as catalysts for "potential value creation." MEMC is hosting its annual shareholder meeting today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • SVA

    Sinovac Biotech (SVA +3.9%) says a new drug application for its proprietary EV71 vaccine has...

    Sinovac Biotech (SVA +3.9%) says a new drug application for its proprietary EV71 vaccine has been filed and accepted by the Beijing Drug Administration. SVA completed the Phase III clinical trials for the vaccine in March, and top-line data showed approximately a 95% efficacy rate against HFMD caused by enterovirus 71. The Administration plans to conduct an on-site inspection and will submit its opinion to China's Food and Drug Administration for further review and evaluation.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • VRTX

    Privately held Alios BioPharma says it's begun Phase I oral dosing in clinical trials of...

    Privately held Alios BioPharma says it's begun Phase I oral dosing in clinical trials of ALS-8176, its anti-respiratory syncytial virus nucleoside analog being developed for the treatment of acute RSV infection. The advancement is a positive for Vertex Pharmaceutical (VRTX +4%), who recently reported positive clinical data with VX-135, its anti-HCV nucleotide analog. Due to their high barrier to viral resistance, nucleoside analogs have become the backbone of antiviral therapy, including the treatment of HIV, hepatitis B virus and herpes simplex virus.
